alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Eastern Windsor; Essex; Lamoille; Orleans; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 9:25PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Rain,Snow Showers and eventually scattered Snow Squalls across central and eastern Vermont through Midnight... At 925 pm...scattered valley rain showers and higher elevation mixed rain and snow showers was occurring across the Champlain Valley as well as the Green Mountains. This activitiy will continue moving east for the next few hours. The main action is a cold front with snow showers and some scattered snow squalls approaching the Champlain Valley. This will move into the Green Mountains between 1030 and 11 pm continuing east across eastern Vermont before exiting after midnight. Heavy snow showers and scattered snow squalls is likely across this area. Be prepared for rapidly changing road conditions, initially poor visibility and then slushy and snow covered roads, especially higher elevations and brisk winds of 30 mph or greater. A dusting to a few inches of snow accumulation is likely, especially higher terrain. Temperatures will fall below freezing thus allowing any wet, slushy or snow covered roads to freeze overnight. If you do not need to travel, please stay home. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Caledonia; Eastern Windsor; Essex; Lamoille; Orleans; Western Windsor
